DML-PLR (Partially Linear Regression) with tidymodels

dml_plr.Rd

DML-PLR (Partially Linear Regression) with tidymodels

Usage

dml_plr(
  data,
  y,
  d,
  x,
  folds_outer = make_folds(data, v = 5),
  resamples_tune = rsample::vfold_cv(data, v = 5),
  m_model = "rf",
  g_model = "rf",
  recipe_shared = NULL,
  recipe_m = NULL,
  recipe_g = NULL,
  impute_predictors = FALSE,
  grid_size = list(m = 15, g = 15),
  vcov_type = "HC2"
)

Arguments

data

Data frame

y

Outcome column

d

Treatment column

x

Character vector of predictors

folds_outer

Outer folds (shared by both nuisances) for cross-fitting

resamples_tune

Resamples for global tuning (e.g., vfold_cv on df)

m_model, g_model

Either a parsnip spec or one of "rf","xgb","glmnet","linear"

recipe_shared

Optional recipe or factory used for both nuisances

recipe_m, recipe_g

Optional separate recipe or factory for each nuisance

grid_size

list(m=, g=) grid sizes for tuning

vcov_type

Sandwich variance type (e.g., "HC2")

Value

list with estimate, SE, CI, and objects for audit
